name: Bookstore
description: The Organization bookstore is a resource for members for Organization books and literature, as well as other gift items. An enjoyment of books and meeting people is desired. Once trained, volunteers are encouraged to sign up for 1–2 shifts per month on weekends and/or special events.

contains.name: Caretaker Committee
contains.description:
The Caretaker Committee manages the Caretaker Fund.

The Caretaker Fund is an officially recognized and designated permanent fund available to provide support to members of Organization who are struggling financially due to exceptional circumstances.

name: COMMUNITY SUPPORT

contains.name: MARKETING
Website & Social Media
contains.description: The Website & Social Media Teams develop the Organization website and social media accounts.
Coordinates and communicates our message both internally and to the community. Responsibilities include our website, Facebook, Twitter, and all brochures, ads, signage, and mailings.

contains.name: Community Service
contains.description: This department provides opportunities for our membership to contribute to the well-being of others locally and globally. The Community Service Team meets on the 4th weekend each month, and coordinates a number of outreach projects throughout the year. We look forward to your participation with our team as we answer the call to assist those in need.

contains.name: GardenCare
contains.description: The GardenCare department creates, coordinates, and implements activities that increase our environmental awareness and spiritual connection with all life. The team typically meets on the 2nd weekend of each month, and hosts hospitality each 3rd weekend after the morning event. They also provide volunteer time on Organization grounds or other areas of the campus that need assistance.

contains.name: Information Technology
contains.description: Calling all techies! Are you an IT professional or just technically inclined? We need more technical types to be on call to help the office staff with computer issues. Some projects we’ve completed: installed a cellular repeater on the roof, re-wired the network closet, upgraded WiFi access, and built a special purpose computer for the Live Streaming team.

contains.name: Social Justice
contains.description:
Organization has a long history of participation in social justice activities. The Social Justice Team (SJT) is planning new activities and projects whenever members express an interest and include a willingness to volunteer in leadership roles.

The Social Justice Team conducts discussions during relevant Organization Friday movie nights, provides facts related to social justice topics in the bulletin, and informs the Organization of speakers on Social justice.

description: This department provides opportunities for our membership to contribute to the well-being of others locally and globally. The Community Service Team meets on the 4th weekend each month, and coordinates a number of outreach projects throughout the year. We look forward to your participation with our team as we answer the call to assist those in need.

name: Music & Arts
description: The Organization Chorus brings beautiful music to our events, holidays, and special events throughout the year. Music practices are Thursday evenings from 7:30 to 9 p.m.

name: Retreat
description: Our Retreat department creates and supports opportunities to “go apart for a while”, in inspirational settings beyond our campus. Retreats are offered at least two weekends a year. Department members’ service is intuitively directed and guided, and delivers meaningful retreat experiences for participants.

name: MEDIA SUPPORT

contains.name: AUDIO VISUAL
Live Streams
contains.description: Operates the live streaming console during morning events to provide live access on our website.

contains.name: Sound
contains.description: Staffs the sound booth during normal events as well as all official Organization functions, and records each event for sale.

contains.name: Visual Projection
contains.description: Operates the computer and video projectors during normal and special events.
This team manages the sound board, PowerPoint presentations, and Live Streaming during normal and special events. Volunteers can be trained in one or all sub-teams.

contains.name: Hospitality
contains.description: This team hosts the fellowship in the morning after both events and provides coffee, tea, and refreshments. Occasionally this service is extended to support special meetings.

contains.name: Welcomers
contains.description: Our Welcomers Team provides first-time guests with an authentic ongoing experience of caring, fellowship, and the beginnings of a transformed life. Our ushers greet everyone, hand out monthly publications. They spend time with newcomers to show them around, answer their questions, and make sure they feel welcome.

description: MEDIA SUPPORT Teams ensure a smooth running service week after week.
